abstract: Since the government took over Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, taxpayers have spent more than $160 million defending their former top executives in fraud lawsuits.
snippet: Since the government took over Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, taxpayers have spent more than $160 million defending their former top executives in fraud lawsuits.
lead_paragraph: Since the government took over Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, taxpayers have spent more than $160 million defending the mortgage finance companies and their former top executives in civil lawsuits accusing them of fraud. The cost was a closely guarded secret until last week, when the companies and their regulator produced an accounting at the request of Congress.

headline.main: Mortgage Giants Leave Legal Bills to the Taxpayers
headline.print_headline: MORTGAGE GIANTS LEAVE LEGAL BILLS TO THE TAXPAYERS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal National Mortgage Association Fannie Mae
